Posts.EditableText: I installed Quest on my work PC (Win 7 / IE8) but it always comes up with the following error. [attachment=0:39q8r3bn]error.jpg[/attachment:39q8r3bn] I think this is because our PCs sit behind a corporate firewall. Is there a setting somewhere that will allow me to get the listings. I've looked through the registry and nothing stands out not is there anything in options. I tried to set the url to a safe site in Explorer but it requires a HTTPS url. I can still peruse and download via IE and then OPEN the file. I can live with it, as my home PC is OK. Just nice to catch up a bit when I have some free time at work.
Posts.HTML:
I installed Quest on my work PC (Win 7 / IE8) but it always comes up with the following error.

I think this is because our PCs sit behind a corporate firewall.
Is there a setting somewhere that will allow me to get the listings. I've looked through the registry and nothing stands out not is there anything in options. I tried to set the url to a safe site in Explorer but it requires a HTTPS url. I can still peruse and download via IE and then OPEN the file.
I can live with it, as my home PC is OK. Just nice to catch up a bit when I have some free time at work.

Posts.EditableText: Quest requests http://www.textadventures.co.uk/gamesxml.php - if your firewall doesn't permit access to that, there's not much that you can do except ask whoever administers it.
Posts.HTML: Quest requests http://www.textadventures.co.uk/gamesxml.php - if your firewall doesn't permit access to that, there's not much that you can do except ask whoever administers it.

Posts.EditableText:
Thanks Alex.
I'll have a look at allowable sites in the Antivirus (Mcafee) and see if I can adjust the security levels in IE. Otherwise I'll just do it the long way like I do now.

Thanks Alex.
